node.title: Debate continues over the Victoria's controversial pandemic bill
node.alt: The Upper House of the Victorian Parliament at work.
node.description: MPs in the Victorian upper house debateÂ the government's pandemic bill into the early hours of Wednesday morning, with dozens of amendments still to be discussed.
node.content: ["Victorian upper house MPs are continuing to debate the state government's pandemic legislation, after some last-minute changes were made to the bill to secure the support of an additional MP.", "Members of the Legislative Council continued to debate the Public Health and Wellbeing Amendment (Pandemic Management) Bill on Wednesday morning.", "The bill, which gives the premier and health minister the power to declare a pandemic and enforce restrictions, is set to replace the state of emergency that expires on December 15.", "The government has secured the support of crossbenchers Transport Matters MP Rod Barton, Animal Justice Party MP Andy Meddick, Reason Party MP Fiona Patten and Greens leader Samantha Ratnam to pass the bill.", "It had initially thought the bill would pass last sitting week with the support of Mr Meddick, Ms Patten and Ms Ratnam but needed an additional vote after former Labor minister Adem Somyurek declared he would return from a self-imposed absence to vote against it.", "\"It is 5.03am. There have been a lot of questions on clause 12, so 2 hours later we have got to the first amendment to this clause. 60+ to go,\" Ms Ratnam tweeted on Wednesday.", "In exchange for Mr Barton's support, the government made six amendments to the bill including the creation of a joint parliamentary committee that could review public health orders and recommend they be overruled by a majority of both houses of parliament.", "A proposed aggravated offence, under which egregious restriction breaches could have been punishable by up to two years' jail, was also removed.", "\"This is a far better bill than what we had and we have curbed the powers of this government,\" Mr Barton told reporters outside Parliament on Tuesday.", "He said with the December 15 deadline fast approaching, a decision had to be made.", "\"Just think about the ramifications of what that would be for this state. You can imagine how quickly the borders would be shut to us from other states.\"", "Several groups who initially held concerns about the bill, including the Centre for Public Integrity, the Human Rights Law Centre, the Law Institute of Victoria and Liberty Victoria have welcomed the amendments.", "During debate, Victorian Attorney-General Jaclyn Symes accused some of her fellow MPs of spreading misinformation about the bill.", "\"To make a statement that there could be a pandemic in a faraway land and the premier's going to go 'you know what? Smell that\u00a0pandemic\u00a0all the way over there in some other country that half of us haven't heard of?\u00a0I'm going to declare a pandemic so I can lock Victorians down', that is ludicrous,\" she said.", "Ms Symes interrupted Liberal MP Bev McArthur, who claimed the bill would allow the premier to lock the state down even if there were no cases anywhere in the country.", "\"No, no, this is the misinformation that I'm a little bit sick of being peddled around, and the reason why people are so scared when you have members of parliament that make these false statements,\" Ms Symes said.", "Liberal MP Gordon Rich-Phillips criticised the rushed nature of the debate.", "AAP/ABC"]
